pageContext.description: Unlooped, with sunken shield ornament on both sides. The seam, formed by the infiltration of metal during casting between the two halves of the mould, is strongly marked on one side, causing one half of the implement to be broader than the other.
pageContext.associations: It seems to be part of a hoard of 12; the present abode of 3 of them is uncertain.
pageContext.publications: Lockhart, C., Guide to the Isle of Wight (1870), p. 36,Wilkins, Dr., History of the Isle of Wight (1859), p. 52
pageContext.collection: Carisbrooke Museum,2.B,Presented by Sir John Simeon, Bart. M.P. to the Isle of Wight Philosophical Society in the Museum at Ryde 1870
pageContext.site: England, isle of wight,ryde,st. john's park,found in laying the foundation of leavington house,1858
